The term "airsoft replica" is not explicitly mentioned or defined in the provided Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville by-laws. However, the by-laws do contain definitions and regulations for "firearms" and "weapons," under which an airsoft replica might be classified depending on its specific characteristics and capabilities.

Definitions from By-laws

  • According to By-law 2019-119 and By-law 2020-087, a "Firearm" is defined as "a barrelled weapon from which any shot, bullet or other projectile can be discharged that is capable of causing bodily injury or death to a Person, and includes any frame or receiver of such a barrelled weapon and anything that can be adapted for use as a firearm, and includes shotguns, rifles, air guns, spring guns or any class thereof."

  • In By-law 2020-087, a "Weapon" is defined as "anything used, designed to be used or intended for use in causing death or injury to any person or animal, or anything used, designed to be used or intended for use for the purpose of threatening or intimidating any person and, without restricting the generality of the foregoing, includes any firearm."

Regulations for Firearms and Weapons

  • By-law 2019-119 regulates the discharge of firearms and bows within the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville. It defines specific "Defined Areas" where discharging firearms is restricted. Exceptions are outlined for Peace Officers, landowners protecting property (under specific conditions), and licensed hunters or trappers (under specific conditions). The by-law also prohibits the discharge of a firearm or bow within 200 meters of any Educational Property used for educational purposes, with exceptions for properties used for instruction in the proper use of firearms or bows.

  • By-law 2020-087, which regulates the use of parks, trails, park buildings, and open spaces, explicitly states that "No person shall... carry a weapon in a park." This by-law also prohibits playing games involving thrown, hurled, or propelled objects in areas of a park not designated for that type of game if it may cause an element of danger to any person not involved in the same game or activity.

Whether a specific airsoft replica falls under the definitions of "firearm" or "weapon" would depend on its individual characteristics, such as its capability to cause bodily injury or death, or its design and intent for use in threatening or intimidating a person. If an airsoft replica is considered an "air gun" or a "weapon" based on these definitions, then the regulations outlined in By-law 2019-119 and By-law 2020-087 would apply.

However, depending on its characteristics, an airsoft replica may fall under the definitions of "Firearm" or "weapon" as outlined in existing by-laws, which would subject it to specific regulations.

Discharge of Firearms

According to By-law 2019-119, a "Firearm" is defined as "a barrelled weapon from which any shot, bullet or other projectile can be discharged that is capable of causing bodily injury or death to a Person, and includes any frame or receiver of such a barrelled weapon and anything that can be adapted for use as a firearm, and includes shotguns, rifles, air guns, spring guns or any class thereof." Given that airsoft replicas are a type of air gun and are capable of discharging projectiles that can cause bodily injury, they would likely be considered a "Firearm" under this by-law.

If an airsoft replica is considered a Firearm, its discharge within the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville is regulated. Generally, no person shall discharge any Firearm within the Town, with specific exceptions. These exceptions include:

  • A Peace Officer, Conservation Officer, or Deputy Conservation Officer in the course of their duties.
  • A landowner or tenant, or an Agent with prior written permission, for the Protection of Property from nuisance wildlife, provided the property is outside the Defined Areas, or within Defined Areas if the parcel is a minimum of 10 acres and within a specific zoning, and no bullet or shot passes over the boundary.
  • The owner or occupier of land, or a licensed hunter or Trapper with prior written permission, for hunting, trapping, or target shooting on lands outside the Defined Areas, provided the parcel is no less than 25 acres, and no shot or bullet passes over the boundary.

For detailed information on Defined Areas, please refer to Schedule "A" and "B" of By-law 2019-119.

Carrying Weapons in Parks and Public Places

The Parks By-law, By-law 2020-087, prohibits carrying a weapon in a park. A "weapon" is defined in this by-law as "anything used, designed to be used or intended for use in causing death or injury to any person or animal, or anything used, designed to be used or intended for use for the purpose of threatening or intimidating any person and, without restricting the generality of the foregoing, includes any firearm." If an airsoft replica is considered a "Firearm" under By-law 2019-119, it would also be considered a "weapon" under By-law 2020-087, and therefore prohibited in parks.

Noise Regulation

The Town's Noise By-law, By-law 2019-092, as amended by By-law 2024-077, By-law 2024-042, and By-law 2022-080, regulates various types of noise. Specifically, it restricts the "operation of a combustion engine for a toy or a replica of a larger device such as a remote controlled toy aeroplane" between 9:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. (to 9:00 a.m. on Sundays and Holidays). While this refers to noise from a combustion engine, it indicates that "replicas of larger devices" are considered in the context of noise regulation.

For any specific airsoft replica, its classification and the applicability of these by-laws would depend on its design, function, and capability to cause injury, as interpreted by municipal law enforcement.

original_data.filtered_answer:
Regulation of Airsoft Replicas in Whitchurch-Stouffville

In the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville, the regulation of devices like airsoft replicas falls under By-law 2019-119, which governs the discharge of Firearms and Bows. According to this by-law, a "Firearm" is defined as:

  • A barrelled weapon from which any shot, bullet or other projectile can be discharged that is capable of causing bodily injury or death to a Person, and includes any frame or receiver of such a barrelled weapon and anything that can be adapted for use as a firearm, and includes shotguns, rifles, air guns, spring guns or any class thereof.

Therefore, if an airsoft replica is considered an "air gun" and is capable of causing bodily injury or death, its discharge is regulated by By-law 2019-119.

General Regulations for Discharge of Firearms (including applicable air guns)

By-law 2019-119 generally prohibits the discharge of any Firearm or Bow within the Town, with specific exceptions:

  • Peace Officers, Conservation Officers, or Deputy Conservation Officers may discharge a Firearm in the course of their duties.
  • Landowners or tenants, or their Agents with prior written permission, may discharge a Firearm for the Protection of Property from nuisance wildlife.
    • Outside the Defined Areas (as described in Schedule "A" and/or illustrated in Schedule "B" of the by-law), this is permitted.
    • Within the Defined Areas, this is permitted if the parcel of land is within any zone of Section 4 pursuant to the Town's Zoning By-law and is a minimum of 10 acres in size, provided no bullet or shot passes over the boundary of the lands.
  • Landowners or occupiers of land, or licensed hunters or Trappers with prior written permission, may discharge a Firearm for the purpose of hunting or trapping:
    • Within the Defined Areas, if the land is being used for agriculture and the owner or occupier has a valid Farm Business Registration number, provided no bullet or shot passes over the boundary.
    • Outside the Defined Areas, if the parcel of land is no less than 25 acres in size, for hunting, trapping, or target shooting, provided no shot or bullet passes over the boundary.
  • Discharge of a Bow (which includes crossbows, long bows, re-curve bows, and compound bows) for hunting or target shooting is permitted outside the Defined Areas, or within the Defined Areas on parcels of land no less than 10 acres in size, provided no bolt or arrow passes over the boundary.
  • A Person firing blank ammunition which does not discharge a projectile for lawful use in a motion picture, television, or stage production, historical play, or for starting/controlling a sporting event.

Prohibitions and Exemptions

  • No person authorized to discharge a Firearm or Bow shall discharge it within 200 metres of the periphery of any Educational Property used for educational purposes, except for properties used for instruction in the proper use of Firearms or Bows.
  • Any Person may make an application to Council to be granted an exemption from any of the provisions of By-law 2019-119 with respect to the discharge of Firearms or Bows. Council may grant or refuse such an exemption, and may include terms and conditions.

Penalties

Every person who contravenes a provision of By-law 2019-119 is guilty of an offence and is subject to penalties, including fines, as outlined in the by-law and the Provincial Offences Act.

For specific details regarding your airsoft replica and its classification under the by-law, it is recommended to review the full text of By-law 2019-119 and consider consulting with the Town's By-law Enforcement or Legal Services if you require a definitive interpretation for your specific situation.

original_data.filtered_answer:
Regulation of Airsoft Replicas in Whitchurch-Stouffville

In the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville, airsoft replicas, being a type of air gun or spring gun, are considered "firearms" under By-law 2019-119. This by-law regulates the discharge of firearms and bows for public safety.

Discharge of Firearms (including Airsoft Replicas)

By-law 2019-119 defines specific "Defined Areas" within the Town where the discharge of firearms is restricted. Generally, no person shall discharge any firearm or bow within the Town, with certain exceptions:

  • Peace Officers, Conservation Officers, or Deputy Conservation Officers in the course of their duties.
  • A landowner or tenant, or an Agent with prior written permission, for the Protection of Property from nuisance wildlife, under specific conditions regarding location (outside Defined Areas, or within Defined Areas on parcels of land a minimum of 10 acres in size and within certain zoning, ensuring no bullet or shot passes over the boundary).
  • A landowner or occupier of land, or a licensed hunter or Trapper with prior written permission, for hunting or trapping, under specific conditions regarding location (within Defined Areas for agriculture with a valid Farm Business Registration number, or outside Defined Areas on parcels of land no less than 25 acres in size, ensuring no shot or bullet passes over the boundary).
  • A person firing blank ammunition for lawful use in productions or sporting events.

It is prohibited to discharge a firearm or bow within 200 metres of the periphery of any Educational Property used for educational purposes, except for properties used for instruction in the proper use of firearms or bows.

Council may grant exemptions from these provisions upon application, with discretion to refuse or grant with terms and conditions.

Airsoft Replicas in Parks

By-law 2020-087, which regulates the use of Parks, Trails, Park Buildings, and Open Spaces, prohibits carrying a "weapon" in a park. A "weapon" is defined as anything used, designed to be used, or intended for use in causing death or injury to any person or animal, or for threatening or intimidating any person, and explicitly includes any firearm. Therefore, airsoft replicas are prohibited in Town parks.

Additionally, By-law 2020-087 prohibits hunting, maiming, injuring, trapping, or disturbing any animal, bird, waterfowl, worms, or other wildlife in a park unless authorized by the Town in consultation with Conservation Authorities.

Penalties

Contravention of the provisions of By-law 2019-119 or By-law 2020-087 can result in penalties, including fines. For By-law 2019-119, fines can range from $250.00 to $50,000.00 for a first conviction, and up to $100,000.00 for subsequent convictions or continuing offences. For By-law 2020-087, fines can range from $300.00 to $50,000.00 for a first conviction, and up to $100,000.00 for subsequent convictions or continuing offences.

Given that airsoft replicas are a type of air gun or spring gun designed to discharge projectiles and are capable of causing bodily injury, they would likely fall under this definition.

Airsoft replicas, by their nature, are designed to propel projectiles and could be considered a weapon under this definition.

Discharge of Airsoft Replicas (Firearms)

The discharge of firearms, which would include airsoft replicas if they meet the definition of a "Firearm" as described above, is regulated by By-law 2019-119. Generally, the by-law restricts the discharge of firearms within the Town, especially within "Defined Areas" (as described in Schedule "A" and illustrated in Schedule "B" of the by-law). Exceptions to this prohibition are very specific and include:

  • Peace Officers, Conservation Officers, or Deputy Conservation Officers in the course of their duties.

  • Landowners or occupiers, or licensed hunters/trappers with prior written permission, for hunting or trapping purposes, subject to specific land use (agriculture), valid Farm Business Registration numbers (within Defined Areas), and land size requirements (e.g., 25 acres outside Defined Areas).

It is prohibited to discharge a firearm or bow within 200 meters of the periphery of any Educational Property used for educational purposes, except for properties used for instruction in the proper use of firearms or bows.

Carrying Airsoft Replicas (Weapons) in Parks

Under By-law 2020-087 (Parks By-Law), Section 4.1(e) explicitly states: "No person shall... carry a weapon in a park." During the winter months, from December 1st of each year to March 31st of the following year, parking is generally prohibited on any highway under the Town's jurisdiction between the hours of 2:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m. This restriction is detailed in Section 17(a) of By-law 2008-114.

Exceptions to Winter Parking Restrictions:

The following locations are exempt from the winter parking prohibition (2:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m. from December 1st to March 31st), as per By-law 2008-114 (Sections 17(b) and 17(c)) and By-law 2024-001:

Opening a Restaurant in Whitchurch-Stouffville

The ability to open a restaurant in the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville depends on the specific zoning of the property where you intend to operate. Zoning by-laws regulate the types of uses permitted in different areas of the Town.

General Permitted Uses for Restaurants

  • Some by-laws indicate that restaurants are permitted in certain commercial and industrial zones. For example, By-law 1984-073 amends previous by-laws to allow "Restaurant including Take-Out Restaurant" as an additional use in a Commercial General (Cl) Zone.
  • By-law 1985-149 permits "Restaurant and Banquet Facility" in an Industrial Restricted Zone (M1*) on part of Park Lot 1, Registered Plan 59, with the gross floor area devoted to public use not to exceed 25% of the building's gross floor area.
  • For the property at 12555 Tenth Line (known as The Stouffville Country Market), By-law 2000-067 permits "Restaurants, Snack Bars" and specifies that these must be conducted and contained within a building.
  • Specific properties, such as 12332 Woodbine Avenue in the Community of Gormley, have zoning that explicitly permits a restaurant. By-law 2010-037 (Highway Commercial Zone) and By-law 2010-042 (General Commercial Zone) both state that the only permitted use on these lands shall be a restaurant, with or without a drive-thru component. These by-laws also specify regulatory provisions such as:
    • Minimum Landscaped Area between a street and parking areas or driveways: 4.0 metres
    • Minimum number of Parking Spaces required: 43
    • Minimum queue length for a restaurant with a drive-through: 20 vehicles
    • Maximum seating capacity of the restaurant: 55

Specific Restrictions and Definitions

  • It is important to note that not all areas permit restaurants. For instance, By-law 1978-079 prohibits "Restaurants" on lands located in part of Lot 1, Concession 4, being more particularly described as Parts 1, 6 and 7 on a plan of reference filed in the Registry Office for the Registry Division of York North as number RS 359.
  • By-law 2022-067 clarifies that "Home occupations do not include ... restaurants". This by-law also provides a specific definition for "Restaurant, Take-out" as a place where food and/or beverages are principally taken out and not intended to be consumed on site, and it shall not have more than 12 seats, inclusive of seats provided on a patio.

Menu Items

The provided by-laws do not contain information regarding specific menu items, such as Sichuan hot pot, hairy tripe, or duck blood. Zoning by-laws typically regulate the type of establishment and its operational characteristics (e.g., seating, parking, drive-thru), not the specific food served.

To determine if your proposed Chinese restaurant, including Sichuan hot pot and special dishes, is permitted, you would need to identify the specific address or location within the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville where you plan to open. The zoning for that particular property would dictate the permitted uses and any associated conditions or restrictions.

While some by-laws, such as By-law 2013-168 and By-law 2016-068, define "Agricultural Uses" to include "raising livestock or other animals, including horses, poultry and fish," these definitions are generally in the context of rural or agricultural properties and do not specifically address the keeping of poultry in residential backyards.

If a chicken coop were to be considered an accessory building, its construction would be subject to the general regulations for accessory buildings. For example, By-law 2011-123 (amending By-law 2010-001-ZO) outlines conditions for accessory buildings in residential zones, including:

  • Permitted in interior side, exterior side, and rear yards.
  • No closer than 0.6 metres to any side lot line and 1.2 metres to a rear lot line.
  • Maximum height of 2.2 metres for flat-roofed, domed, and Quonset structures, and 2.5 metres for pitched or mansard-roofed structures.
  • Maximum ground floor area not exceeding 12 square metres or 5% of the lot area, whichever is lesser.

However, these regulations pertain to the physical structure itself and do not grant permission for the keeping of chickens or the use of such a structure as a chicken coop in a residential zone. The provided by-laws do not contain specific provisions on the legality of keeping chickens in residential areas.
original_data.laymans_answer:
The Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville's by-laws don't specifically permit or prohibit keeping chickens or having a chicken coop in a residential backyard.

Some by-laws define "Agricultural Uses" to include raising poultry, but these definitions generally apply to rural or agricultural properties, not residential areas.

If a chicken coop is considered an accessory building, it must meet certain requirements. Accessory buildings are allowed in side and rear yards, but must be at least 0.6 metres from side lot lines and 1.2 metres from a rear lot line. Flat-roofed, domed, and Quonset structures can be a maximum of 2.2 metres high, while pitched or mansard-roofed structures can be 2.5 metres high. The ground floor area cannot exceed 12 square metres or 5% of the lot area, whichever is less.

However, these accessory building regulations only cover the structure itself. They don't grant permission to keep chickens in a residential zone. The by-laws provided don't have specific rules about the legality of keeping chickens in residential areas.

original_data.query: Can I park my car facing the wrong way on the street?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire as to the permissibility of parking a motor vehicle contrary to the lawfully designated direction of travel on a public roadway within the Town's municipal boundaries, pursuant to current Traffic and Parking Bylaws, specifically concerning regulations governing vehicle orientation, direction of facing, and authorized parking configurations. This inquiry excludes matters pertaining to animal control, property rights, waste management, public health, and zoning ordinances, focusing solely on vehicular parking regulations currently in effect.
original_data.filtered_answer:
Parking Direction on Highways

No, you cannot park your car facing the wrong way on the street in the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville.

According to By-law 2008-114, as amended by By-law 2017-027, Section 6(a)(xviii) states that "No person shall park any vehicle on any highway: with the front of the vehicle facing opposite to the direction in which vehicular traffic is proceeding on that side of the street."
original_data.laymans_answer:
Parking Direction on Highways

No, you cannot park your car facing the wrong way on the street in the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville.

You must park with the front of your vehicle facing the same direction as the flow of traffic on your side of the street.

original_data.query: میشه تو حیاط استخر ساخت؟
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding the permissibility of constructing a private swimming pool within the boundaries of a residential property, specifically the rear yard. This inquiry necessitates a determination of compliance with all applicable Town bylaws, including but not limited to zoning ordinances governing setbacks, lot coverage, and permissible structures; public health regulations pertaining to water quality and safety; and any relevant building codes currently in effect regarding pool construction standards.
original_data.filtered_answer:
ساخت استخر در حیاط

بله، ساخت استخر شنا در حیاط در شهر ویچورچ-استوفویل مجاز است، اما مشروط به رعایت مقررات و شرایط خاصی است که در آیین‌نامه‌های شهر ذکر شده است. این مقررات شامل الزامات مربوط به مکان، عقب‌نشینی، محصور کردن، و استفاده از آب می‌شود.

مکان و عقب‌نشینی

  • استخر شنا به عنوان یک کاربری فرعی برای کاربری‌های مسکونی مجاز است. (By-law 2020-058)
  • استخر شنا در حیاط جلویی در هیچ منطقه‌ای مجاز نیست. (By-law 2020-058)
  • استخر شنا می‌تواند در حیاط پشتی، حیاط جانبی بیرونی، یا حیاط جانبی داخلی هر قطعه زمین قرار گیرد. (By-law 2020-058)
  • لبه آب استخر شنا نباید به هیچ خط قطعه زمین یا خط خیابان نزدیک‌تر از 1.2 متر باشد. (By-law 2020-058)
  • در مناطق روستایی، استخر شنا در حیاط جانبی مجاز است، به شرطی که هیچ بخشی از آن به خط قطعه زمین یا خط خیابان نزدیک‌تر از حداقل فاصله مورد نیاز برای ساختمان اصلی نباشد. حداکثر ارتفاع چنین استخری 1.5 متر بالاتر از سطح متوسط زمین در مجاورت و در فاصله 4.5 متری از استخر است. (By-law 1974-031)
  • در حیاط پشتی، استخر شنا نباید به هیچ خط قطعه زمین یا خط خیابان نزدیک‌تر از حداقل فاصله مورد نیاز برای یک ساختمان فرعی باشد. (By-law 1974-031)
  • برای قطعه زمین خاصی در لات 32، بخش 6، حداقل عقب‌نشینی حیاط جانبی جنوبی برای استخر شنا 9 متر است. (By-law 1989-065)
  • در منطقه RRC (مسکونی تفریحی)، استخر شنا در منطقه استفاده انحصاری برای هیچ واحد مسکونی مجاز نیست. (By-law 1998-231)

مجوزها و محصور کردن

  • قبل از حفاری یا ساخت استخر شنا، یا ساخت یا نصب محوطه اطراف آن، باید نقشه‌های محوطه به مسئول ارشد ساختمان ارائه شود، هزینه مجوز پرداخت شود و مجوز تأیید نقشه‌ها صادر شود. (By-law 2013-168)
  • در صورت نیاز به دسترسی یا کار در ملک شهر برای ساخت استخر یا محوطه آن، مجوز تجاوز به ملک (encroachment permit) لازم است. (By-law 2013-168)
  • هیچ آبی نباید در استخر شنا ریخته شود یا در آن باقی بماند مگر اینکه محوطه مورد نیاز نصب شده باشد. اگر ریختن آب بخشی از تکنیک ساخت و ساز باشد، یک محوطه موقت باید قبل از افزودن آب نصب و تا زمان نصب و تأیید محوطه دائمی نگهداری شود. (By-law 2013-168)
  • هر استخر شنا باید به طور کامل توسط یک محوطه (مانند نرده یا دیوار) احاطه شود تا دسترسی کودکان خردسال به آن محدود شود. (By-law 2013-168)
  • ارتفاع محوطه، از جمله دروازه‌ها، باید حداقل 1.5 متر باشد و نباید در نزدیکی هیچ شیء دائمی قرار گیرد که به کاهش این الزامات ایمنی کمک کند (مانند تسهیل بالا رفتن از محوطه). هیچ شکافی در داخل یا زیر محوطه نباید از 100 میلی‌متر تجاوز کند. (By-law 2013-168)
  • هیچ بخشی از محوطه نباید شامل سیم خاردار، سیم تیغ‌دار یا هر وسیله‌ای باشد که برای هدایت جریان الکتریکی از طریق آن طراحی شده باشد. (By-law 2013-168)
  • دروازه‌های محوطه باید خودبسته، قابل قفل شدن و خودقفل‌شونده باشند و دستگاه بازکننده باید در بالای دروازه قرار گیرد. (By-law 2013-168)
  • اگر دیوار ساختمانی بخشی از محوطه باشد، هر در یا دروازه ورودی به محوطه باید مجهز به قفل یا وسیله مناسب دیگری باشد که حداقل 1.5 متر بالاتر از سطح زمین قرار گیرد. (By-law 2013-168)
  • هیچ بخشی از محوطه نباید در فاصله 1.2 متری از لبه آب استخر شنا قرار گیرد. (By-law 2013-168)
  • استخرهای آب گرم (Hot Tubs)، جکوزی‌ها و اسپاها در صورتی که دارای پوشش محکم و قفل‌شونده باشند، از الزامات محصور کردن معاف هستند. (By-law 2013-168)

پوشش زمین و تجهیزات

  • استخر شنا یا جکوزی در محاسبه پوشش زمین (lot coverage) لحاظ نمی‌شود. (By-law 2020-058، By-law 1996-078)
  • تجهیزات مکانیکی استخر شنا (مانند پمپ‌ها، فیلترها و گرم‌کننده‌ها) می‌توانند در حیاط پشتی، حیاط جانبی داخلی یا حیاط جانبی بیرونی قرار گیرند، اما نباید به خط قطعه زمین پشتی، خط قطعه زمین داخلی و خط قطعه زمین جانبی بیرونی نزدیک‌تر از 0.6 متر باشند، در صورتی که عقب‌نشینی مورد نیاز بیش از 0.6 متر باشد. (By-law 2020-058)

زهکشی و استفاده از آب

  • نصب استخر شنا یا محوطه آن نباید الگوی زهکشی موجود قطعه زمین را تغییر دهد، مگر اینکه توسط مسئول ارشد ساختمان تأیید شود. مالک باید اطمینان حاصل کند که الگوی زهکشی جدید بر زمین‌های همسایه تأثیر منفی نمی‌گذارد. (By-law 2013-168)
  • تخلیه آب استخر شنا و آب بک‌واش (backwash) به خیابان جلوی ملک مالک مجاز است، اما تنها پس از حذف مواد آلی از آب و اجازه دادن به آب برای حداقل 3 روز بدون افزودن هیچ گونه مواد شیمیایی یا جلبک‌کش. (By-law 2006-162)
  • هیچ شخصی نباید آب استخر شنا را بدون رضایت مالک آن ملک، به ملک دیگری تخلیه کند. (By-law 2006-162)
  • محدودیت‌های استفاده از آب در فضای باز برای پر کردن استخرهای شنا اعمال می‌شود. (By-law 2004-087)
    • از 15 مه تا 30 سپتامبر هر سال، پر کردن استخرها تنها در روزهای زوج برای آدرس‌های زوج و در روزهای فرد برای آدرس‌های فرد، و فقط بین ساعات 6:00 صبح تا 10:00 صبح و 6:00 بعد از ظهر تا 10:00 بعد از ظهر مجاز است.
    • در طول اعلامیه مرحله 1 (Stage 1 Advisory)، از پر کردن استخرها درخواست می‌شود خودداری شود.
    • در طول ممنوعیت مرحله 2 (Stage 2 Ban)، پر کردن استخرها ممنوع است.
    • یک استثنا وجود دارد: پر کردن مجدد استخر مسکونی حیاط خلوت برای حفظ یکپارچگی سیستم فیلتراسیون در طول مرحله 1 یا 2 مجاز است.

برای اطلاعات دقیق‌تر و اطمینان از رعایت تمامی مقررات مربوط به ملک خاص خود، توصیه می‌شود با بخش برنامه‌ریزی و ساختمان شهر ویچورچ-استوفویل تماس بگیرید.
original_data.laymans_answer:
ساخت استخر در حیاط

بله، ساخت استخر شنا در حیاط در شهر ویچورچ-استوفویل مجاز است، اما باید مقررات خاصی را رعایت کنید.

مکان و عقب‌نشینی

  • استخر شنا در حیاط جلویی مجاز نیست.
  • استخر شنا می‌تواند در حیاط پشتی، حیاط جانبی بیرونی، یا حیاط جانبی داخلی قرار گیرد.
  • لبه آب استخر شنا نباید به خط قطعه زمین یا خط خیابان نزدیک‌تر از 1.2 متر باشد.
  • در مناطق روستایی، حداکثر ارتفاع استخر در حیاط جانبی 1.5 متر بالاتر از سطح متوسط زمین است.
  • در حیاط پشتی، استخر شنا نباید به خط قطعه زمین یا خط خیابان نزدیک‌تر از حداقل فاصله مورد نیاز برای یک ساختمان فرعی باشد.
  • برای قطعه زمین خاصی در لات 32، بخش 6، حداقل عقب‌نشینی حیاط جانبی جنوبی برای استخر شنا 9 متر است.
  • در منطقه RRC (مسکونی تفریحی)، استخر شنا در منطقه استفاده انحصاری برای هیچ واحد مسکونی مجاز نیست.

مجوزها و محصور کردن

  • قبل از ساخت استخر یا محوطه اطراف آن، باید نقشه‌ها را به مسئول ارشد ساختمان ارائه دهید و مجوز بگیرید.
  • اگر نیاز به کار در ملک شهر دارید، مجوز تجاوز به ملک (encroachment permit) لازم است.
  • قبل از پر کردن استخر، باید محوطه (مانند نرده) نصب شود.
  • هر استخر شنا باید توسط یک محوطه احاطه شود تا دسترسی کودکان خردسال محدود شود.
  • ارتفاع محوطه باید حداقل 1.5 متر باشد و هیچ شکافی نباید از 100 میلی‌متر تجاوز کند.
  • محوطه نباید شامل سیم خاردار یا وسیله‌ای برای هدایت جریان الکتریکی باشد.
  • دروازه‌های محوطه باید خودبسته، قابل قفل شدن و خودقفل‌شونده باشند.
  • اگر دیوار ساختمان بخشی از محوطه باشد، هر در یا دروازه ورودی باید مجهز به قفل باشد که حداقل 1.5 متر بالاتر از سطح زمین قرار گیرد.
  • هیچ بخشی از محوطه نباید در فاصله 1.2 متری از لبه آب استخر شنا قرار گیرد.
  • استخرهای آب گرم (Hot Tubs)، جکوزی‌ها و اسپاها در صورتی که دارای پوشش محکم و قفل‌شونده باشند، نیازی به محصور کردن ندارند.

پوشش زمین و تجهیزات

  • استخر شنا یا جکوزی در محاسبه پوشش زمین لحاظ نمی‌شود.
  • تجهیزات مکانیکی استخر شنا نباید به خط قطعه زمین پشتی، خط قطعه زمین داخلی و خط قطعه زمین جانبی بیرونی نزدیک‌تر از 0.6 متر باشند.

زهکشی و استفاده از آب

  • ساخت استخر نباید الگوی زهکشی موجود را تغییر دهد.
  • تخلیه آب استخر شنا به خیابان جلوی ملک مجاز است، اما پس از حذف مواد آلی و اجازه دادن به آب برای 3 روز بدون مواد شیمیایی.
  • تخلیه آب استخر شنا به ملک دیگری بدون رضایت مالک آن ملک مجاز نیست.
  • محدودیت‌های استفاده از آب در فضای باز برای پر کردن استخرهای شنا اعمال می‌شود:
    • از 15 مه تا 30 سپتامبر، پر کردن استخرها فقط در روزهای زوج برای آدرس‌های زوج و در روزهای فرد برای آدرس‌های فرد، بین ساعات 6:00 صبح تا 10:00 صبح و 6:00 بعد از ظهر تا 10:00 بعد از ظهر مجاز است.
    • در طول اعلامیه مرحله 1، از پر کردن استخرها خودداری کنید.
    • در طول ممنوعیت مرحله 2، پر کردن استخرها ممنوع است.
    • پر کردن مجدد استخر مسکونی حیاط خلوت برای حفظ سیستم فیلتراسیون در طول مرحله 1 یا 2 مجاز است.

برای اطلاعات دقیق‌تر، با بخش برنامه‌ریزی و ساختمان شهر ویچورچ-استوفویل تماس بگیرید.

original_data.query: برای نصب سیستم آبیاری در حیاط احتیاج به کارهایی هست؟
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding the permissibility and regulatory requirements for the installation and operation of an irrigation system on residential property within the Town. Specifically, what obligations, permissions, or prohibitions exist under current zoning ordinances, water usage bylaws, property standards regulations, and any applicable environmental protection bylaws pertaining to water conservation, landscaping, and potential impacts on public health or drainage systems? This inquiry prioritizes bylaws enacted or amended within the last five years.
original_data.filtered_answer:
الزامات نصب سیستم آبیاری در حیاط

برای نصب سیستم آبیاری در حیاط خود در شهر ویچورچ-استوفویل، چندین الزام و ملاحظه وجود دارد که باید رعایت کنید:

  • مجوز اتصال به سیستم آب (Permit to Connect): اگر نصب سیستم آبیاری شما نیاز به اتصال جدید یا ارتقاء اتصال موجود به سیستم آب شهری دارد، باید برای «مجوز اتصال» از شهر درخواست دهید. این موضوع در بخش 3.5 از By-law 2018-055 (سیستم آب) ذکر شده است.
  • مجوز لوله‌کشی (Plumbing Permit): برای هرگونه ساخت و ساز مربوط به خدمات آب در ملک خصوصی، باید یک «مجوز لوله‌کشی» جداگانه از اداره خدمات توسعه شهر (Development Services Department) دریافت کنید. این الزام در بخش 4.1 از By-law 2018-055 آمده است.
  • عدم اتصال متقاطع (Cross-Connections): هیچ گونه اتصال متقاطع بین آب آشامیدنی و سایر منابع مجاز نیست. این امر برای جلوگیری از آلودگی سیستم آب شهری بسیار مهم است و در بخش 7.5 از By-law 2018-055 تاکید شده است.
  • محدودیت‌های استفاده از آب: پس از نصب، استفاده از سیستم آبیاری برای آبیاری چمن‌ها و باغ‌ها تابع محدودیت‌های استفاده از آب در فضای باز خواهد بود. این محدودیت‌ها معمولاً از 15 می تا 30 سپتامبر هر سال اعمال می‌شوند و استفاده از آب را به روزهای زوج برای آدرس‌های زوج و روزهای فرد برای آدرس‌های فرد، و فقط بین ساعات 6:00 صبح تا 10:00 صبح و 6:00 بعد از ظهر تا 10:00 شب محدود می‌کند. همچنین، هشدارهای مرحله 1 و ممنوعیت‌های مرحله 2 نیز ممکن است اعمال شوند. این موارد در بخش 1 از By-law 2004-087 (محدودیت‌های آب) توضیح داده شده است.
  • جلوگیری از هدر رفتن آب: هیچ کس نباید آب آشامیدنی را به صورت بی‌رویه یا هدر دهنده استفاده یا تخلیه کند. این یک ممنوعیت کلی است که در بخش 16.1 از By-law 2018-055 ذکر شده است.
  • زهکشی (Drainage): باید اطمینان حاصل کنید که زهکشی ملک به گونه‌ای نگهداری می‌شود که از جمع شدن آب یا رواناب به املاک همسایه جلوگیری کند. سیستم آبیاری شما باید با این الزامات مطابقت داشته باشد. این موضوع در بخش‌های 9.1 و 9.2 از By-law 2016-068 (مقررات) آمده است.

برای اطمینان از رعایت کامل تمامی مقررات، توصیه می‌شود قبل از شروع هرگونه کار، با بخش‌های مربوطه شهر مشورت کنید.
original_data.laymans_answer:
الزامات نصب سیستم آبیاری در حیاط

برای نصب سیستم آبیاری در حیاط خود در شهر ویچورچ-استوفویل، باید موارد زیر را رعایت کنید:

  • اگر برای نصب سیستم آبیاری نیاز به اتصال جدید به سیستم آب شهری دارید، باید از شهر «مجوز اتصال» دریافت کنید.
  • برای هرگونه ساخت و ساز مربوط به خدمات آب در ملک خصوصی، باید یک «مجوز لوله‌کشی» از اداره خدمات توسعه شهر دریافت کنید.
  • از اتصال متقاطع بین آب آشامیدنی و سایر منابع جلوگیری کنید تا آب آلوده نشود.
  • استفاده از سیستم آبیاری برای چمن‌ها و باغ‌ها تابع محدودیت‌های استفاده از آب است که معمولاً از 15 می تا 30 سپتامبر اعمال می‌شود و استفاده از آب را محدود می‌کند. به طور کلی، آبیاری در روزهای زوج برای آدرس‌های زوج و روزهای فرد برای آدرس‌های فرد، و فقط بین ساعات 6:00 صبح تا 10:00 صبح و 6:00 بعد از ظهر تا 10:00 شب مجاز است.
  • از استفاده بی‌رویه یا هدر دادن آب آشامیدنی خودداری کنید.
  • اطمینان حاصل کنید که زهکشی ملک از جمع شدن آب یا رواناب به املاک همسایه جلوگیری کند و سیستم آبیاری شما با این الزامات مطابقت داشته باشد.

توصیه می‌شود قبل از شروع هرگونه کار، با بخش‌های مربوطه شهر مشورت کنید.

original_data.query: Do I need a permit to install a sprinkler system for my lawn?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire as to the requirement for a permit, license, or other authorization from the Town for the installation and operation of an automated irrigation system, specifically a lawn sprinkler system, on residential property. This inquiry pertains to compliance with current bylaws and regulations concerning water usage, property standards, zoning ordinances, and any applicable environmental protection or conservation measures, including but not limited to restrictions enacted within the preceding [Number] years.
original_data.filtered_answer:
Permit Requirements for Sprinkler System Installation

Yes, you will need a permit to install a sprinkler system for your lawn in the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville.

According to By-law 2018-055, which governs the Municipal Waterworks Distribution System:

  • Section 4.1 states that an Owner must "make a separate application for a Plumbing Permit to the Town's Development Services Department ('Development Services') for construction to be performed on private property."
  • The installation of a sprinkler system, as it connects to the municipal water supply on private property, falls under this requirement.
  • All Private Side Water Services, including connections for systems like sprinklers, must be installed to the satisfaction of the Town's Chief Building Official (Section 7.1 of By-law 2018-055).

Associated costs for a Plumbing Permit, including those related to water service installation, are outlined in the Town's Fees and Charges By-law. For specific fees, you would refer to By-law 2024-144 (specifically Schedule E, Item 7 for Water Service, Drain and Sewer connections).

For further details and to obtain the necessary application, please contact the Town's Development Services Department.
original_data.laymans_answer:
Yes, you need a permit to install a sprinkler system for your lawn in Whitchurch-Stouffville.

You must apply for a Plumbing Permit from the Development Services Department for any construction on private property that connects to the municipal water supply. This includes sprinkler systems.

All water service connections, including those for sprinkler systems, must meet the Town's standards.

The Town's Fees and Charges By-law 2024-144 outlines the costs for a Plumbing Permit related to water service installation.

Contact the Development Services Department for application details.

original_data.query: برای نصب سیستم آبیاری باید جواز گرفت؟
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire whether the installation and operation of an irrigation system on a property within the Town requires a permit, license, or other form of authorization under current municipal bylaws, including but not limited to zoning ordinances, water usage regulations, property standards bylaws, and public health regulations pertaining to water conservation and waste management. Determine if any restrictions, prohibitions, or obligations apply to such installations, considering recently enacted amendments and effective dates.
original_data.filtered_answer:
بله، برای نصب سیستم آبیاری که به سیستم آبرسانی شهری متصل می‌شود، نیاز به اخذ مجوز دارید.

بر اساس By-law 2018-055، مالکانی که نیاز به خدمات آبرسانی جدید یا ارتقاء خدمات موجود دارند، باید برای «مجوز اتصال» (Permit to Connect) از شهر درخواست دهند. همچنین، برای هرگونه ساخت و ساز در ملک خصوصی، باید درخواست جداگانه‌ای برای «مجوز لوله‌کشی» (Plumbing Permit) به اداره خدمات توسعه شهر ارائه شود.

استفاده از آب قبل از بازرسی و تأیید اتصال خدمات آب خصوصی توسط خدمات توسعه مجاز نیست. علاوه بر این، هیچ شخصی نباید بدون رضایت کتبی قبلی شهر، به هیچ سرویس آب یا سرویس آب خصوصی متصل شود.

برای خدمات آبرسانی جدید یا ارتقاء خدمات موجود، باید برای «مجوز اتصال» از شهر درخواست دهید. همچنین، برای هرگونه ساخت و ساز در ملک خصوصی، باید درخواست جداگانه‌ای برای «مجوز لوله‌کشی» به اداره خدمات توسعه شهر ارائه شود.

استفاده از آب قبل از بازرسی و تأیید اتصال خدمات آب خصوصی توسط خدمات توسعه مجاز نیست. علاوه بر این، بدون رضایت کتبی قبلی شهر، به هیچ سرویس آب یا سرویس آب خصوصی متصل نشوید.

original_data.query: برای نصب سیستم آبیاری باید جواز گرفت؟ و هزینه آن چقدر هست؟
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding the necessity of obtaining a permit or authorization for the installation and operation of an irrigation system on a property within the Town's jurisdiction, pursuant to applicable bylaws, including but not limited to zoning ordinances, water usage regulations, and property standards bylaws currently in effect. Request clarification on associated fees, if any, for said permit or authorization, as per the most recent fee schedule.
original_data.filtered_answer:
مجوزها و هزینه‌های نصب سیستم آبیاری

برای نصب سیستم آبیاری که به سیستم آب شهری متصل می‌شود، نیاز به اخذ مجوز از شهر Whitchurch-Stouffville دارید. این فرآیند شامل دو نوع مجوز اصلی است:

  • مجوز اتصال (Permit to Connect): این مجوز برای اتصال به خط اصلی آب شهری مورد نیاز است.
  • مجوز لوله‌کشی (Plumbing Permit): این مجوز برای کارهای لوله‌کشی در ملک خصوصی شما صادر می‌شود.

بر اساس By-law 2018-055، مالک مسئول نصب و نگهداری سیستم آب خصوصی در ملک خود است و تمامی آب مصرفی باید از طریق کنتور اندازه‌گیری شود.

هزینه‌های مربوطه (بر اساس By-law 2024-144، که از 1 ژانویه 2025 لازم‌الاجرا است):

هزینه‌ها بسته به نوع و اندازه اتصال و کنتور متفاوت است:

  • هزینه درخواست مجوز اتصال (Permit to Disconnect or Connect):
    • برای اندازه سرویس 25 میلی‌متر یا کمتر (مسکونی استاندارد): 100.00 دلار
    • برای اندازه سرویس بزرگتر از 25 میلی‌متر (تجاری): 964.00 دلار
  • هزینه تامین و نصب کنتور آب (Water Meter Supply and Installation):
    • برای کنتور 3/4 در 3/4 اینچ (مسکونی استاندارد): 529.00 دلار
    • برای کنتور 1 اینچ (مسکونی استاندارد): 696.00 دلار
    • برای سایر اندازه‌های کنتور: هزینه واقعی کنتور به اضافه 20% هزینه اداری.
    • برای نصب کنتورهای با اندازه دیگر: هزینه واقعی نصب به اضافه 20% هزینه اداری.
  • هزینه نصب اتصال (Connection Installation Cost):
    • ودیعه اولیه: حداقل 10,000.00 دلار.
    • هزینه اتصال برای املاک مسکونی: هزینه واقعی به اضافه 10% هزینه اداری.
    • هزینه اتصال برای املاک تجاری، صنعتی و چندمسکونی: هزینه واقعی به اضافه 20% هزینه اداری.
  • هزینه‌های اضافی احتمالی:
    • اگر نیاز به قطع و وصل آب در ساعات کاری عادی شهرداری باشد: 100.00 دلار.
    • اگر نیاز به قطع و وصل آب پس از ساعات کاری عادی شهرداری باشد (فقط برای موارد اضطراری): 256.00 دلار.
    • جریمه مصرف آب قبل از نصب کنتور (در صورت تخلف از By-law 2018-055 بخش 11.13): 1,000.00 دلار برای هر دوره صورتحساب (3 ماهه).

لطفاً توجه داشته باشید که این هزینه‌ها ممکن است بر اساس شرایط خاص ملک شما و نیازهای سیستم آبیاری متفاوت باشد. برای جزئیات دقیق‌تر و درخواست مجوز، باید با بخش خدمات توسعه شهر تماس بگیرید.

original_data.query: I want to open a law firm in the town, mainly dealing with disputes in the financial field. Is that okay?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding permissible land uses and zoning regulations pertaining to the establishment and operation of a professional office, specifically a law firm specializing in financial dispute resolution, within the Town's jurisdictional boundaries. Determine compliance requirements concerning business licensing, property standards, and any applicable bylaws regulating professional services, public access, or noise levels, considering the most current and recently amended versions of all relevant municipal codes.
original_data.filtered_answer:
Opening a Law Firm in Whitchurch-Stouffville

Based on the provided by-laws, opening a law firm, which falls under the category of a professional office, is permitted in certain zoned areas within the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville. The specific zoning of your intended location will determine if a law firm is a permitted use. Here are the types of zones where professional offices or offices, including those for lawyers, are permitted according to the by-laws:
  • General Commercial (GC) Zones: Professional offices are permitted in areas zoned General Commercial. For example, By-law 1986-164 permits "Business offices" and "Professional offices" in a GC zone in Lot 35, Concession 4. Similarly, By-law 2010-083 permits "Business and professional offices" in a GC zone at 6568 Main Street, Stouffville.
  • Local Commercial (LC) Zones: "Business Offices" and "Professional Offices" are permitted in LC zones. By-law 1991-108 permits these uses (excluding dentist offices) in a Local Commercial zone, such as Block A, Plan M-1620, Felcher Boulevard. By-law 1997-014 also permits "Business Offices" and "Professional Offices" in an LC zone at 5267 Aurora Road.
  • Rural Zone RU*: Specifically, By-law 1986-126 permits "Professional offices for engineers, architects and lawyers" in a Rural Zone RU* located in Lot 22, Concession 8.
  • General Commercial-Holding (CG(15)(h-1)) Zones: By-law 2011-103 permits "Offices" and "Studios" in a CG(15)(h-1) zone, subject to the execution of a Site Plan Control Agreement with the Town for the release of the holding symbol.
  • Accessory Buildings (with specific conditions): A "Business Office" may be permitted in an existing accessory building under very specific conditions and restrictions, such as those outlined in By-law 2002-159 for the property at 12045 McCowan Road. This by-law includes limitations on size, outdoor storage, and the number of businesses. Please note that some past by-laws permitting business offices in accessory buildings were temporary and have since expired (e.g., By-law 1993-053, By-law 1996-057, By-law 1993-105).
The provided by-laws do not specify any restrictions on the type of legal practice (e.g., dealing with financial disputes) within the general category of "lawyer" or "professional office." To determine the exact requirements for your specific location, you would need to confirm its current zoning designation.
original_data.laymans_answer:
Opening a Law Firm in Whitchurch-Stouffville

You can open a law firm in Whitchurch-Stouffville in certain zones. These zones include General Commercial (GC), Local Commercial (LC), and Rural (RU*) zones. One by-law, 2011-103, requires a Site Plan Control Agreement in General Commercial-Holding (CG(15)(h-1)) zones. Under specific conditions, a "Business Office" may be allowed in an existing accessory building, but there are restrictions on size and outdoor storage. The zoning of your specific location will determine if a law firm is permitted. The rules don't specify restrictions on the type of legal practice you can offer. To find out the exact requirements for your location, confirm its current zoning designation.

original_data.query: What are the sign by laws for putting up signs to promote my business in public spaces?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding current municipal regulations governing the placement, erection, and maintenance of signage for commercial purposes within public rights-of-way and municipally-owned spaces. Specifically, what permissions, prohibitions, and obligations exist under relevant bylaws, including but not limited to zoning ordinances, sign bylaws, and any applicable provisions related to property standards, public nuisance, visual blight, and waste management, concerning temporary and permanent signage intended to advertise or promote a business, good, or service?
original_data.filtered_answer:
Sign Regulations for Business Promotion in Public Spaces

Generally, the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville by-laws prohibit the placement of signs for business promotion on public property or public rights-of-way. However, there are specific exceptions and conditions under which certain types of signs may be permitted.

General Prohibition

  • Signs are generally not permitted on public lands, public property, or public rights-of-way for commercial advertising, unless explicitly allowed by a by-law or erected by a governmental body. This is outlined in By-law 2016-012 (Section 3(f) and 3(p)) and By-law 2016-165 (Section 3(a)).

Exceptions for Business Promotion Signs on Public Property

1. A-Frame (Sandwich Board) Signs

Within the Downtown Stouffville Special Sign District:

  • One A-frame sign is permitted per business on municipal property immediately abutting the business operation.
  • The sign must be removed to an indoor location no later than the time of business closing and not replaced until opening the next day.
  • It must not obstruct the view of drivers or the movement of pedestrians on a sidewalk, ensuring a minimum clearance of 1.52 meters (approximately 5 feet) for pedestrian traffic.
  • The sign must be anchored in place (e.g., by weight) to prevent movement due to wind.
  • Size restrictions: Maximum height of 1.25 meters, maximum width of 0.8 meters, and maximum area of 0.70 square meters per side.
  • If located on municipal property, the sign owner must provide a letter of indemnification for the Town and add the Town to their insurance for liability in the amount of $2,000,000.00.
  • A sign permit is required but is not subject to a processing fee.
  • The Municipality may remove any A-frame sign on public lands for public safety reasons.
  • (Refer to By-law 2016-012, Schedule "A", Section 6 and By-law 2016-165, Section 5).

Outside the Downtown Stouffville Special Sign District:

  • A-frame signs are generally required to be located entirely on private property.
  • However, one A-frame sign may be permitted on a highway or sidewalk under Town jurisdiction if the main front wall of the building is located within 1.5 meters of the highway or sidewalk.
  • Similar to Downtown Stouffville, this requires a minimum clearance of 1.5 meters for pedestrian traffic and the owner must provide a letter of indemnification and add the Town to their insurance for liability in the amount of $2,000,000.00.
  • (Refer to By-law 2016-165, Section 5(c) and 5(i)).

2. Temporary Signs for Special Events

Temporary signs may be placed on public lands for "Special Events" as defined in By-law 2016-165 (Section 10). A "special event" is organized or sponsored by a community service group, charity, or non-profit organization for a charitable, social, cultural, promotional, fundraising, or recreational purpose.

  • These signs may contain commercial advertisement only to identify sponsors of the event.
  • A valid sign permit must be obtained.
  • The permit is issued for a maximum of 21 days prior to the event date.
  • Signs must be removed no later than 48 hours after the special event.
  • Maximum of two sign faces, with no one sign face greater than 0.37 square meters.
  • A maximum of 50 temporary signs per permit are allowed within the Town.
  • Setbacks: 15 meters from an intersection or traffic signal, 3 meters from any driveway or property line, and 10 meters from any other temporary sign.
  • If located on municipal property, the owner must provide a letter of indemnification for the Town and add the Town to their insurance for liability in the amount of $2,000,000.00.
  • (Refer to By-law 2016-165, Section 3(a)(ii) and Section 10).

3. Other Sign Types (Mobile, Inflatable, Feather Banner)

  • Mobile Signs, Inflatable Signs, and Feather Banner Signs are generally not permitted on public property for business promotion.
  • Within the Downtown Stouffville Special Sign District, these types of signs are explicitly prohibited.
  • Outside Downtown Stouffville, these signs are permitted on private properties in commercial, employment, or institutional zones, provided a valid sign permit is obtained and specific restrictions are met. They are not generally permitted on public lands for business promotion, except as part of a "special event" to identify sponsors (as noted above for temporary signs).
  • (Refer to By-law 2016-012, Schedule "A", Sections 7.2 and 8.1; By-law 2016-165, Sections 7(h), 8(g), and 9(i)).

Permit Requirements and Fees

  • For any sign requiring a permit, an application must be submitted to the Clerk or designate, including a diagram of the proposed sign location and a letter of consent from the property owner (if applicable).
  • Municipal fees for administration and enforcement activities related to signs are set out in the Town's current Fees and Charges By-law. Application fees are generally paid upon submission.
  • (Refer to By-law 2016-165, Section 11 and 13).

For specific details regarding your business location and the type of sign you wish to erect, it is recommended to consult the full text of By-law 2016-165 and By-law 2016-012.
original_data.laymans_answer:
Sign Regulations for Business Promotion in Public Spaces

Generally, Whitchurch-Stouffville does not allow signs for business promotion on public property. However, there are exceptions.

General Prohibition

  • Commercial advertising signs are generally not allowed on public lands unless specifically permitted.

Exceptions for Business Promotion Signs on Public Property

1. A-Frame (Sandwich Board) Signs

Within the Downtown Stouffville Special Sign District:

  • One A-frame sign is allowed per business, right in front of the business.
  • Signs must be removed indoors when the business is closed and brought back out when open.
  • Ensure the sign doesn't block drivers' views or pedestrian traffic (minimum 1.52 meters/5 feet clearance).
  • Anchor the sign to prevent it from blowing over.
  • Size limits: 1.25 meters high, 0.8 meters wide, and 0.70 square meters per side.
  • You must provide a letter protecting the Town from liability and add the Town to your insurance ($2,000,000.00 coverage).
  • A sign permit is required (no fee).
  • The Town may remove unsafe signs.

Outside the Downtown Stouffville Special Sign District:

  • A-frame signs must be on private property.
  • However, if your building's front wall is very close (within 1.5 meters) to the sidewalk, one A-frame sign might be allowed on the sidewalk.
  • You must maintain 1.5 meters of pedestrian clearance and provide a letter of indemnification and add the Town to your insurance ($2,000,000.00 coverage).

2. Temporary Signs for Special Events

Temporary signs are allowed on public lands for special events organized by community groups, charities, or non-profits.

  • Signs can only advertise event sponsors.
  • You need a sign permit.
  • Permits are for a maximum of 21 days before the event.
  • Signs must be removed within 48 hours after the event.
  • Maximum of two sign faces, each no larger than 0.37 square meters.
  • Up to 50 signs are allowed per permit.
  • Keep signs 15 meters from intersections/traffic signals, 3 meters from driveways/property lines, and 10 meters from other temporary signs.
  • You must provide a letter protecting the Town from liability and add the Town to your insurance ($2,000,000.00 coverage).

3. Other Sign Types (Mobile, Inflatable, Feather Banner)

  • Mobile signs, inflatable signs, and feather banner signs are generally not allowed on public property.
  • These signs are not allowed at all in the Downtown Stouffville Special Sign District.
  • Outside of Downtown, these signs are allowed on private commercial, employment, or institutional properties with a permit, but not on public land except to identify sponsors of a "special event" as described above.

Permit Requirements and Fees

  • To get a sign permit, apply to the Clerk with a diagram of where you want to put the sign and permission from the property owner (if needed).
  • There are fees for sign permits.

For details about your specific situation, consult By-law 2016-165 and By-law 2016-012.

original_data.query: Do I need a permit for fill in my backyard?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding the necessity of obtaining a permit or authorization from the Town for the placement, deposit, or introduction of fill material within the boundaries of a residential property. This inquiry pertains to compliance with current zoning bylaws, property standards regulations, waste management provisions, and any applicable environmental protection ordinances governing land alteration, grading, drainage, and soil management, effective as of the current date.
original_data.filtered_answer:
Site Alteration Permit Requirements for Fill

Generally, a Site Alteration Permit is required for any alteration to the grade of property through the movement, removal, or placing of fill within the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville. This is outlined in By-law 2024-037, Section 2.1, which states that "No Person shall undertake, cause, or permit any Site Alteration of any Property within the Town without the Owner of the property first receiving a Site Alteration Permit issued under this By-law authorizing the Site Alteration."

Exemptions for Small Volumes of Fill

However, By-law 2024-037 (Section 3.2) provides specific one-time allowances for placing fill without a Site Alteration Permit, based on the size of your property:

  • For properties 0.1 hectares or less, you may place a maximum of 10 cubic metres of fill once.
  • For properties between 0.1 and 0.2 hectares, you may place a maximum of 50 cubic metres of fill once.
  • For properties between 0.2 and 0.5 hectares, you may place a maximum of 100 cubic metres of fill once.
  • For properties 0.5 hectares or larger, you may place a maximum of 450 cubic metres of fill once.

It is important to note that these are one-time allowances. Any site alteration involving fill that exceeds these maximum volumes is prohibited unless a Site Alteration Permit is issued by the Commissioner.

Requirements for Imported Fill

If you plan to import fill onto your property, additional requirements apply:

  • For any imported fill greater than 30 cubic metres, you must provide source site chemical testing and lab results to the Town, to the satisfaction of the Commissioner (By-law 2024-037, Section 2.5).
  • All fill used on any property must meet applicable Site Condition Standards, must not contain putrescible materials, and must be free of termites and Invasive Species, including their eggs and seeds (By-law 2024-037, Section 2.12).

Fees and Other Considerations

If your project requires a Site Alteration Permit, application fees, peer review cash account deposits, and security deposits will be required, as set out in the Town's Fees and Charges By-law. Municipal Service Fees per cubic metre of fill may also apply for the importation or exportation of fill (By-law 2024-037, Section 4.8). By-law 2002-014 also details various fees related to fill permits and inspections.

For specific details regarding your property and proposed fill activities, it is recommended to consult the full text of By-law 2024-037 and the Town's Fees and Charges By-law.
original_data.laymans_answer:
Site Alteration Permit Requirements for Fill

Generally, you need a Site Alteration Permit to change your property's grade by moving or placing fill in Whitchurch-Stouffville.

Exemptions for Small Volumes of Fill

However, you can place a limited amount of fill without a permit, one time only. The amount depends on your property size:

  • 0.1 hectares or less: Maximum 10 cubic metres.
  • 0.1 to 0.2 hectares: Maximum 50 cubic metres.
  • 0.2 to 0.5 hectares: Maximum 100 cubic metres.
  • 0.5 hectares or larger: Maximum 450 cubic metres.

Exceeding these amounts requires a Site Alteration Permit.

Requirements for Imported Fill

Importing fill has extra rules:

  • More than 30 cubic metres requires source site chemical testing results for the Town.
  • All fill must meet standards, be free of rot, termites, and invasive species (including eggs and seeds).

Fees and Other Considerations

Permits require application fees and deposits. Fees per cubic metre of fill may also apply. Consult the Town's Fees and Charges By-law for details.

For specifics, it's best to consult By-law 2024-037 and the Fees and Charges By-law.

original_data.query: Can I park my car on the street overnight during the winter?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding the permissibility of overnight on-street parking of motor vehicles within the Town, specifically during the winter season, as defined by applicable bylaws. Request clarification on any existing prohibitions, restrictions, or exemptions pertaining to vehicle parking on municipal roadways between specified hours, considering relevant traffic, zoning, and public safety regulations, including but not limited to snow removal and emergency access provisions, as currently enacted and enforced.
original_data.filtered_answer:
Winter Overnight Parking Regulations in Whitchurch-Stouffville

Generally, parking your car on the street overnight during the winter months in Whitchurch-Stouffville is restricted. According to By-law 2008-114, Section 17(a), no person shall park any vehicle on any highway under the jurisdiction of the Town at any time during the hours of 2:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m. from December 1st of each year to March 31st of the following year.

However, there are specific exceptions where overnight parking is permitted during the winter months:

  • 24-Hour Parking Permitted:
    • On the portion of Church Street located south of Main Street (By-law 2008-114, Section 17(b) and By-law 2009-007).
  • Daily 6 p.m. to 2 a.m. Parking Permitted:
    • On Main Street, both sides, from Albert Street to Park Drive (By-law 2021-100).
  • Daily 9 p.m. to 2 a.m. Parking Permitted:
    • In Residential Neighbourhoods, both sides, unless otherwise posted (By-law 2021-100).
  • Daily 4 p.m. to 9 a.m. Parking Permitted:
    • Along the cul-de-sac on Brill Court, both sides (By-law 2009-007, By-law 2021-100).
    • On the East side of Miltrose Crescent parallel to the GO Transit corridor (By-law 2009-007, By-law 2021-100).
    • Adjacent to the stormwater management block/valley view corridor on James Ratcliff Avenue, South/West side (By-law 2009-007, By-law 2021-100).
  • "Anytime" Parking Permitted (Winter Restrictions Do Not Apply):
    • On Dougherty Crescent:
      • East side, parallel to the Ninth Line (By-law 2024-001).
      • East side, between #80 and #126 Dougherty Crescent (By-law 2024-001).
      • North side, between Weldon Road and #73 Dougherty Crescent (By-law 2024-001).
      • South side, between Weldon Road and #127 Dougherty Crescent (By-law 2024-001).
    • On Firbank Lane:
      • North side, between #3 and #23 Firbank Lane (By-law 2024-001).
      • West side, between #26 and #100 Firbank Lane (By-law 2024-001).
    • On Hoppington Avenue, West & South sides, between Mantle Avenue and Firbank Lane (By-law 2024-001).
    • On Jamesway Crescent, East & North sides, between Weldon Road and Dougherty Crescent (By-law 2024-001).
    • On Brown Lane:
      • South side, between #5 and #35 Brown Lane (By-law 2024-095).
      • East side, between #32 (flankage) and #58 Brown Lane (By-law 2024-095).
    • On Betula Gate, West side, between #6 and #22 Brown Lane (flankage) (By-law 2024-095).
    • On Delbert Circle, East side, between #23 and #101 (flankage) (By-law 2024-095).
    • On Fernglen Crescent, West side, between #93 and #113 Fernglen Crescent (By-law 2024-095).

For all other streets not listed in the exceptions above, the general winter overnight parking prohibition from 2:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m. between December 1st and March 31st applies.

original_data.query: What happens if I start building something, like a deck, before I get a building permit?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding the regulatory consequences, including but not limited to penalties and enforcement actions, arising from the commencement of construction, erection, or alteration of a structure, such as a deck or similar improvement, on real property within the Town's jurisdiction, prior to obtaining requisite building permits and approvals as mandated by applicable zoning bylaws, building codes, and related municipal regulations currently in effect.
original_data.filtered_answer:
Building Permits for Construction

In the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville, a building permit is generally required for any construction, demolition, extension, repair, or alteration of a building or its appurtenant systems. This requirement is outlined in By-law 2012-004, Section 6.

Decks and Permit Requirements

For decks specifically, By-law 2012-004 provides an exception. A building permit is not required for residential wood decks where the surface is equal to, or less than, two feet above any point of the ground below the deck (Section 7(1)(iii)).

However, if your deck's surface is more than two feet above the ground, or if you are building something other than a deck that requires a permit, you must obtain a permit from the Chief Building Official before starting work.

Consequences of Starting Work Without a Required Permit

If you commence construction for which a permit is required without first obtaining that permit, you are in contravention of the Town's by-laws. According to By-law 2012-004, Section 33(1), any person who contravenes a provision of this by-law is guilty of an offence and is liable for a fine as established under Section 36 of the Building Code Act, 1992.

Additionally, By-law 1971-030, which regulates construction, alteration, or repair of buildings, states that every owner of property must obtain all applicable permits required for proposed work (Section 1.11(ii)). A breach of this by-law can result in a fine not exceeding $300.00 for each offence, exclusive of costs (Section 1.16(i)). The Magistrate may also order the offender to carry out the requirements of the by-law within a specified time. If the offender defaults, the Inspector of Buildings or any other person may be ordered to enter the premises and demolish or remove the structure, or part thereof, erected contrary to the by-law, at the expense of the offender. These expenses, with costs, are recoverable by action or distress, similar to municipal taxes (Section 1.16(ii)).

It is important to ensure all necessary permits are obtained to avoid penalties and potential orders for removal or demolition at your expense.
original_data.laymans_answer:
Building Permits for Construction

Generally, you need a building permit for construction, demolition, extensions, repairs, or alterations.

Decks and Permit Requirements

You do not need a permit for a residential wood deck if its surface is less than two feet above the ground.

If the deck surface is more than two feet above the ground, you need a permit before you start.

Consequences of Starting Work Without a Required Permit

Starting construction without the required permit means you're breaking the Town's rules. You could be fined.

Also, property owners must obtain all required permits. If you don't, you could be fined and ordered to complete the work as required by the by-law. If you still don't comply, the Town may demolish or remove the unpermitted structure at your expense. These costs can be recovered like municipal taxes.

To avoid penalties and potential removal of your construction at your expense, make sure you get all necessary permits first.

original_data.query: What time do my garbage and recycling bins need to be at the curb?

original_data.filtered_answer:
Garbage and Recycling Bin Set-Out Times

For the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville, the rules for setting out and removing your garbage and recycling bins are outlined in By-law 2018-035, Section 4.7:

  • Approved containers and bundles shall not be placed at the curb or pavement edge before 5:00 p.m. on the day immediately preceding the day designated for collection.
  • Approved receptacles and bundles shall be placed at the curb or pavement edge no later than 7:00 a.m. on the day of collection.
  • All emptied receptacles and uncollected refuse shall be removed from the curb or pavement edge before 8:00 p.m. on the day of collection.

original_data.filtered_answer:
Parking Direction on Streets in Whitchurch-Stouffville

No, you cannot park your car facing opposite to the direction in which vehicular traffic is proceeding on that side of the street in the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville.

This regulation is outlined in By-law 2008-114, which governs and controls the parking of vehicles in the Town. Specifically, Section 6(a)(xviii) of By-law 2008-114 states that "No person shall park any vehicle on any highway: (xviii) with the front of the vehicle facing opposite to the direction in which vehicular traffic is proceeding on that side of the street." This provision was explicitly added and confirmed by By-law 2017-027, which amended By-law 2008-114.

original_data.query: can I raise chickens on my property?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire as to the permissibility of keeping, harboring, or maintaining domestic fowl, specifically Gallus gallus domesticus (chickens), on a residential property within the Town. This inquiry pertains to compliance with all applicable municipal bylaws, including but not limited to animal control regulations, zoning ordinances governing permitted land uses, waste management bylaws related to animal waste disposal, and public health regulations concerning potential nuisances or health hazards. Request current regulations and any amendments enacted within the past five years.
original_data.filtered_answer:
Keeping Chickens on Your Property

The ability to raise chickens on your property in the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville depends on your property's zoning.

  • According to the By-law 2019-047 (Animal Services By-Law), a "chicken" is defined as a "Domestic Animal".

  • For properties located within residential, commercial, industrial, or institutional zoned areas, By-law 2019-047 states that the total number of animals, including dogs, shall not exceed six (6) per single dwelling unit. This by-law specifically prohibits keeping pigeons in these zones, but does not include a similar explicit prohibition for chickens.

  • For other zoned properties, such as rural or agricultural zones, the animal limits specified for residential, commercial, industrial, or institutional zones in By-law 2019-047 do not apply.

  • Furthermore, By-law 2016-068 defines "Agricultural Purposes" as including "the raising of livestock", and chickens are considered livestock. By-law 2013-110 indicates that "Agricultural uses" are permitted in certain zones, specifically mentioning ORM-C, ORM-L, ORM-NC, or ENV Zones within the Oak Ridges Moraine Area.

Therefore, while chickens are recognized as domestic animals, the specific regulations for keeping them will depend on your property's zoning designation. For properties in residential, commercial, industrial, or institutional zones, a limit of six total animals applies. In rural or agricultural zones, agricultural uses, which include raising livestock, are generally permitted, and the animal limits for other zones do not apply.
original_data.laymans_answer:
Keeping Chickens on Your Property

Whether you can raise chickens on your property in Whitchurch-Stouffville depends on how your property is zoned.

  • A "chicken" is considered a "Domestic Animal".

  • If your property is zoned residential, commercial, industrial, or institutional, you can have a maximum of six animals total, including dogs. While pigeons are specifically prohibited, chickens are not.

  • These animal limits do not apply to properties zoned rural or agricultural.

  • Raising livestock, including chickens, is considered an "Agricultural Purpose". "Agricultural uses" are permitted in ORM-C, ORM-L, ORM-NC, or ENV Zones within the Oak Ridges Moraine Area.

In summary, the rules for keeping chickens depend on your property's zoning. There's a six-animal limit for residential, commercial, industrial, and institutional zones. Agricultural uses, including raising livestock, are generally allowed in rural or agricultural zones, and the animal limits for other zones do not apply.

original_data.query: can I cut down trees?
original_data.transformed_query: Inquire regarding permissible tree removal activities within Town limits. Seek clarification on regulations governing tree cutting, felling, and removal, including permit requirements, species restrictions, and protected areas as defined by current zoning bylaws, tree protection bylaws, and environmental conservation regulations. Determine obligations and prohibitions pertaining to tree removal on private and public property, considering potential impacts on adjacent properties, drainage, and applicable waste disposal regulations currently in effect.
original_data.filtered_answer:
Tree Cutting Regulations in Whitchurch-Stouffville

The ability to cut down trees in the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville is regulated by several by-laws, depending on whether the tree is on public or private land, its size, type, and the reason for removal.

Trees on Public Lands (Municipal Trees)

  • For any tree located on a highway, park, woodlot, or other property owned or maintained by the Town (referred to as a Municipal Tree), you generally cannot injure, destroy, or remove it without written permission from the Town's Director of Public Works, Director of Leisure and Community Services, or Director of Development Services. This is outlined in By-law 2020-086.
  • To obtain permission, you typically need to submit an Arborist Report and a Tree Protection Plan.
  • The Director will consider factors such as environmental protection, whether the tree is a Heritage Tree, or if it is protected under the Endangered Species Act.
  • Any approved work must be carried out by or under the supervision of a qualified Arborist, following good arboricultural practices.
  • Compensation for tree removals may be required.
  • The Town's Director is authorized to remove Municipal Trees that are dead, hazardous, or no longer viable to maintain.

Trees on Private Lands

Regulations for cutting trees on private property depend on the tree's size, location within the Town, and whether a development application is involved.

  • General Private Property (By-law 2006-001):
    • A permit is generally required to injure or destroy any tree with a tree diameter greater than 20 centimetres or a base diameter greater than 40 centimetres on privately owned lands not governed by the Regional Municipality of York's Forest Conservation By-law.
    • Exceptions where a permit is NOT required:
      • For emergency work.
      • For the pruning of a tree or removal of dead trees/branches.
      • For trees located on rooftop gardens, interior courtyards, or solariums.
      • For trees reasonably required for utilities or structures where a building permit has been issued (within 15 metres of the building/structure edge).
      • For trees on a nursery, cultivated fruit/nut orchard, or Christmas tree plantation.
      • For activities undertaken by the Town, York Region, or a local board.
      • For trees already under the jurisdiction of the Regional Municipality of York's Forest Conservation By-Law (a permit from the Region may be required).
      • For trees whose removal is a condition of a Planning Act approval (site plan, subdivision, consent) imposed after December 31, 2002.
    • Special Allowance without a Permit: An owner is permitted to remove one (1) tree per calendar year (up to a maximum of five (5) trees total) with a tree diameter greater than 20 centimetres or a base diameter greater than 40 centimetres, provided the tree is not located within 30 metres of the high water mark of a kettle lake or within five (5) metres of the high water mark of a watercourse or a wetland.
    • Applications for permits may require an Arborist Report and a Tree Preservation Plan or Tree Compensation Plan.
  • Private Property within Secondary Plan Areas with a Planning Act Application (By-law 2023-060):
    • This by-law applies to Private Trees, Mature Trees, and Heritage Trees when a Site Plan, Plan of Subdivision, or Consent Application is submitted for new development in areas like Vandorf-Preston Lake, Community of Stouffville, Gormley, Ballantrae-Musselman Lake, and Hamlet of Bloomington.
    • Heritage Trees: The removal or relocation of Heritage Trees is strictly prohibited. They must be identified and protected at all times.
    • Mature Trees (Diameter at Standard Height (DSH) of 30 cm or greater): These trees cannot be removed or relocated without the approval of the Director.
      • Removal may be permitted to accommodate new development, if the tree is a hazard to life or property, a public nuisance, infested by disease/insects, structurally compromised, Dead or Dying, planted too close to another tree, or for other reasons deemed necessary by the Director.
      • An Arborist Report and Landscape Plans are required.
      • If removal is approved, compensation is required, either through planting Replacement Trees (e.g., 3:1 for 30-49cm DSH, 5:1 for 50cm+ DSH) or paying a Cash-in-lieu Compensation fee.
      • Relocation is preferred if preservation is not possible, with all associated costs borne by the owner.
    • Tree Protection Zones (TPZ) with specific hoarding requirements are mandatory for protected trees during construction.
    • Exemptions under this by-law include trees covered by the Region's Forest Conservation By-law, emergency work, trees removed under a Property Standards By-law order, routine utility/tree care company maintenance for safety, trees on certain elevated structures (rooftop gardens, indoor courtyards, solariums, but not parking garages), nursery/orchard trees for sale, golf course trees, tree farm trees, invasive species, and health/safety concerns determined by the Director.

Penalties for Non-Compliance

Contravention of these by-laws can result in significant penalties:

  • Under By-law 2006-001, fines for individuals can be up to $10,000 or $1,000 per tree for a first conviction, and up to $25,000 or $2,500 per tree for subsequent convictions. For corporations, fines can range from $50,000 or $5,000 per tree (first conviction) to $100,000 or $10,000 per tree (subsequent conviction). The court may also order rehabilitation of the affected land.
  • Under By-law 2020-086, fines for contravening provisions related to Municipal Trees can range from $500 to $50,000 for a first conviction, and up to $100,000 for subsequent convictions. Continuing offences can incur daily fines.
  • Under By-law 2023-060, fines for contravening provisions related to Private, Mature, and Heritage Trees can range from $500 to $50,000 for a first conviction, and up to $100,000 for subsequent convictions. Continuing offences can incur daily fines of $2,000 to $10,000 per day. The Town may also perform required work and recover expenses from the owner.

It is always recommended to consult with the Town's relevant department or a qualified arborist before undertaking any tree removal or significant alteration to ensure compliance with all applicable by-laws.
original_data.laymans_answer:
Tree Cutting Regulations in Whitchurch-Stouffville

Whether you can cut down trees in Whitchurch-Stouffville depends on if the tree is on public or private land, its size, and why you want to remove it.

Trees on Public Lands (Municipal Trees)

  • You generally cannot remove trees on Town property (highways, parks, etc.) without written permission from the Town.
  • You'll likely need to submit an Arborist Report and a Tree Protection Plan to get permission.
  • The Town will consider environmental factors and whether the tree is a Heritage Tree or protected under the Endangered Species Act.
  • Approved work must be done by a qualified Arborist.
  • You may need to provide compensation for tree removals.
  • The Town can remove Municipal Trees that are dead or hazardous.

Trees on Private Lands

Rules for cutting trees on private property depend on the tree's size and location.

  • General Private Property:
    • You generally need a permit to remove a tree larger than 20 centimetres in diameter.
    • Exceptions: A permit is NOT required for emergency work, pruning, dead trees/branches, trees in rooftop gardens, trees needing removal for permitted structures (within 15 metres), trees on farms/nurseries, work by the Town or Region, or trees already regulated by the Region.
    • Special Allowance: You can remove one (1) tree per year (up to five total) without a permit if it's larger than 20 centimetres in diameter and not near a kettle lake (within 30 metres) or watercourse/wetland (within 5 metres).
    • You might need to provide an Arborist Report and Tree Preservation/Compensation Plan when applying for permits.
  • Private Property within Secondary Plan Areas with a Planning Act Application:
    • These rules apply when you're submitting a development application in areas like Vandorf-Preston Lake, Community of Stouffville, etc.
    • Heritage Trees: You cannot remove or relocate Heritage Trees.
    • Mature Trees (30 cm diameter or greater): You cannot remove these without approval.
      • Removal might be allowed for development, hazard reasons, or tree health.
      • You'll need an Arborist Report and Landscape Plans.
      • If removal is approved, you'll need to provide compensation by planting new trees or paying a fee.
      • Relocation is preferred over removal.
    • Tree Protection Zones are required during construction.
    • Exemptions: Trees covered by the Region's Forest Conservation By-law, emergency work, trees removed under a Property Standards By-law order, routine utility/tree care company maintenance for safety, trees on certain elevated structures (rooftop gardens, indoor courtyards, solariums, but not parking garages), nursery/orchard trees for sale, golf course trees, tree farm trees, invasive species, and health/safety concerns determined by the Director.

Penalties for Non-Compliance

Breaking these rules can result in fines.

  • Fines can range up to $10,000 or $1,000 per tree for individuals (first conviction) and higher for corporations.
  • Fines for Municipal Trees can range from $500 to $50,000 for a first conviction.
  • Fines related to Private, Mature, and Heritage Trees can range from $500 to $50,000 for a first conviction, with daily fines possible.

It's best to check with the Town or an arborist before removing or significantly altering any tree.

original_data.query: how long can i park on my street
